thread.title: Federated Farmers want international trade open
thread.title_full: Federated Farmers want international trade open

title: Federated Farmers want international trade open
text:
Federated Farmers want international trade open 
Saturday 1 Aug 2015 1:41 p.m. 
Farming (iStock) 
Mr McCully is still in negotiations in Hawaii over the Trans Pacific Partnership Agreement that has Federated Farmers suggesting it's only a good deal if the international dairy trade is opened up. 
Trade ministers from 12 countries are embroiled in a final round of talks in Hawaii right now, as they try to finalise an agreement. 
Dairy exports are a sticking point, with Andrew Hoggard from Federated Farmers insisting there's no point in a free trade deal that doesn't actually allow free trade. 
"Market liberalisation would be a fantastic benefit to New Zealand, especially the dairy industry, so we're just really hoping our negotiators do their job." 
Sources close to the talks say the trade talks are unlikely to end in a deal due to an impasse over trade in autos, dairy goods and monopoly periods for biologic drugs. 
RadioLIVE
